sanskrit_verse: अनपेक्षितमर्यादं नास्तिकं विप्रलुम्पकम् । अनवेक्षितमर्यादं अरक्षितारमत्तारं नृपं विद्यादधोगतिम् ॥ ८.३०९॥
transliteration: anapekṣitamaryādaṁ nāstikaṁ vipralumpakam | anavekṣitamaryādaṁ arakṣitāramattāraṁ nṛpaṁ vidyādadhogatim || 8.309 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A ruler who disregards boundaries, lacks faith in Dharma, causes disruption, fails to uphold standards, neglects protection, and acts from intoxication of power—such a ruler is declared fallen.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inseparable from dharmic responsibility
Causation arises through conscious alignment with cosmic order
Capacity-based responsibility requires sustained awareness and integrity
Restoration logic demands recognition of systemic imbalance before correction
Consciousness alignment determines the legitimacy of governance
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler violates dharmic boundary thresholds THEN declare loss of governing capacity
IF ruler demonstrates persistent neglect of protective duty THEN initiate removal protocol
IF ruler acts under influence of power-intoxication THEN suspend executive function until realignment occurs
IF ruler fails repeated dharmic compliance checks THEN invoke constitutional replacement mechanism
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that sovereign authority derives solely from adherence to Dharma. A ruler's legitimacy is automatically voided upon violation of core dharmic parameters, requiring immediate judicial intervention for restoration rather than prolonged punitive inquiry.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This declaration aligns with pramāṇa-based causality: when a ruler breaches dharma, the natural consequence is disqualification from rulership—not punishment. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) follows logically from the failure to maintain sacred trust. Responsibility is proportional to capacity; thus, higher office incurs greater accountability without recourse to punitive frameworks.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process for unmet kshatriya duties
Assign temporary stewardship to qualified dharmic custodians
Realign fallen ruler through consciousness rehabilitation programs
Restore societal harmony via reintegration of displaced authority structures
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. This law restores Dharma, upholds consciousness as the ultimate judge, and affirms that reality operates beyond punishment—only alignment.
